intro: Xanthochymus macrophyllus, commonly known as the large-leafed yellowwood, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rutaceae and is characterized by its large, lance-shaped leaves and yellow flowers. The species is also notable for its role in ecological systems, supporting various pollinators and contributing to biodiversity.
